author: Special Correspondent
text:
Congress on Monday lodged a complaint against the BJP president Amit Shah at Election Commission of India, accusing Mr. Shah of violating the model code of conduct by making “defamatory” statements against its party vice-president Rahul Gandhi.

In a memorandum to EC, Congress lawyer K.C. Mittal said that since Mr. Shah has wrongly attacked Mr. Gandhi for supporting anti-India slogans that were allegedly raised on JNU campus on February 9, the remarks could “mislead” voters in the poll-bound States. “Such malicious and defamatory statements have been intentionally made at a time when poll exercise has commenced in five States,” the memorandum said.

As per Congress, the statement was made the day after the election dates for Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Assam, Kerala and Puducherry were announced on March 4. Since the model code of conduct was applicable right from the day election dates were announced, Congress asked the EC to take a “stern action” against Mr. Shah.
title: Congress moves EC against Shah
